snippet: The big ballet spring season brings a series of 19th-century classics almost all attributed to the choreographer Marius Petipa. Yet much of what now bears the Petipa brand name has actually been rechoreographed by his successors.
abstract: Alastair Macaulay discusses ballet choreographer Marius Petipa, who created several of the 19th-century classics frequently staged by New York City ballet companies; much of what now bears the Petipa brand name has actually been rechoreographed, but the Pacific Northwest Ballet will present three excerpts of Petipa choreography, notated exactly as they were during his lifetime, at the Guggenheim Museum Works and Process series.
lead_paragraph: The big ballet spring season brings a series of 19th-century classics almost all attributed to the choreographer Marius Petipa. Yet much of what now bears the Petipa brand name has actually been rechoreographed by his successors.

headline.seo: Looking for the Real Petipa in Classical Ballets
